thread.title: Redshirt freshman guard has been one of Alabama's two most consistent O-linemen, Nick Saban says
thread.title_full: Redshirt freshman guard has been one of Alabama's two most consistent O-linemen, Nick Saban says | AL.com

author: Matt Zenitz | mzenitz@al.com
title: Redshirt freshman guard has been one of Alabama's two most consistent O-linemen, Nick Saban says
text:
Alabama coach Nick Saban identified the Tide's two most consistent offensive linemen through five games during his Wednesday night news conference.
One was to be expected â€” senior center Ryan Kelly, a three-year starter who has been named one of Alabama's offensive players of the week after two of the five games.
The other? The Tide's redshirt freshman left guard, Ross Pierschbacher.
"He's done a nice job for us," Saban said.
Ranked by Rivals as a four-star recruit and the eighth-best offensive guard in last year's recruiting class, the 6-foot-4, 300-pound Pierschbacher had not allowed a sack, did not have any missed assignments and recorded 11 knockdown blocks through Alabama's first three games, according to his bio on the Tide athletics website.
The Iowa native is part of an offensive line that has paved the way for running back Derrick Henry to rush for 422 yards and five touchdowns while averaging 6.8 yards per carry against Alabama's three Power Five conference opponents.
Pierschbacher squatted 600 pounds during the Tide's spring testing. That was tied for the best on the team.
His 40-yard dash time (5.19) was tied with freshman lineman Brandon Kennedy for the best among Alabama offensive linemen.
"I'd say (I'm) more of a smart offensive lineman," Pierschbacher said when asked to describe his skill set. "Kind of base my play off of knowing what to do and trying to get there fast and efficiently."
Ross Pierschbacher Ross Pierschbacher discusses Georgia win, improvements on the OL and more.
